properties.name: limits.activiti.mail.breach-url
properties.description: The URL to link when configuring the mail server for breach notifications.

properties.name: limits.activiti.mail.from
properties.description: The email address to use when configuring the mail server for breach notifications.

properties.name: limits.activiti.mail.host
properties.description: The host to use when configuring the mail server for breach notifications.

properties.name: limits.activiti.mail.password
properties.description: The password to use when configuring the mail server for breach notifications.

properties.name: limits.activiti.mail.port
properties.description: The port to use when configuring the mail server for breach notifications.

properties.name: limits.activiti.mail.ssl
properties.description: True if using SSL when configuring the mail server for breach notifications.

properties.name: limits.activiti.mail.tls
properties.description: True if using TLS when configuring the mail server for breach notifications.

properties.name: limits.activiti.mail.username
properties.description: The username to use when configuring the mail server for breach notifications.

properties.name: limits.alert-task.sample-rate-cron
properties.description: Cron expression for the Intraday Alert task's cron job.

properties.name: limits.autoconfiguration.service-principal
properties.description: The name of the user authenticated to perform machine-to-machine requests from Atoti Limits to the connected Atoti Servers, if using JWT Authentication.

properties.name: limits.cube.format.double-format
properties.description: Format value for double measures.

properties.name: limits.cube.format.integer-format
properties.description: Format value for integer measures.

properties.name: limits.cube.format.kpi-goal
properties.description: Format value for KPI Goal values

properties.name: limits.cube.kpi-filters-enabled
properties.description: True if cube filters are enabled for Limits KPIs, false otherwise.

properties.name: limits.cube.scope-hierarchies-enabled
properties.description: True if the scope hierarchies are enabled in the Limits cube, false otherwise. This may be disabled to improve performance for clients with large numbers of limits and in particular a high cardinality of scopes.

properties.name: limits.data-access-control.servers
properties.description: Stores the permissions available to each role, per server

properties.name: limits.data.jpa.repository.packages-to-scan
properties.description: List of packages to scan for Entity classes to be managed by the JPA repositories.

properties.name: limits.data.mode
properties.description: The mode used to load data into Atoti Limits.

properties.name: limits.discovery-manager.polling-delay
properties.description: How long a Discovery's refresh is valid for.

properties.name: limits.dlc.buffer-size
properties.description: The CSV buffer size in KB.

properties.name: limits.dlc.parser-threads
properties.description: The number of threads to be used for data loading.

properties.name: limits.dlc.path-matchers
properties.description: Map of topic name to regular expression to match the CSV file name

properties.name: limits.dlc.root-dir
properties.description: The root directory for Limits data. A default will be created if not set or does not exist.

properties.name: limits.dlc.sub-directory-paths
properties.description: Map of subdirectory paths which would be appended to the root directory.

properties.name: limits.incident.evaluation.error.include-stacktrace
properties.description: If true, the stack trace will be available in the evaluation response to the UI.

properties.name: limits.incident.evaluation.include-passes
properties.description: If true, evaluations resulting in a pass will be persisted to the datastore.

properties.name: limits.incident.evaluation.parallel-tasks
properties.description: Thread pool size for the evaluation task executors.

properties.name: limits.incident.output-data-dir
properties.description: The directory where the alert data is written to.

properties.name: limits.notification.evaluation-completed-notification-user-role
properties.description: The role required to receive the evaluation completed notification.

properties.name: limits.notification.server-started-notification-user-role
properties.description: The role required to receive the server started notification.

properties.name: limits.realtime.emitter-timeout
properties.description: The timeout on each Event Source that a client opens to receive real-time updates on Limits statuses.

properties.name: limits.scope.auto-fill-unambiguous-level-paths
properties.description: If true, allows Limits to automatically fill in missing parent levels with Wildcards

properties.name: limits.scope.force-unambiguous-level-paths
properties.description: If true, this forces that a level be [Unambiguous](#ambiguous-level-path) at load time

properties.name: limits.scope.using-explicit-scope-matching
properties.description: If true, limits will only be shown and applied to the exact location their Scope is defined on

properties.name: limits.structure.templates
properties.description: Stores the LimitStructureTemplates by templateName to ensure each one is unique

properties.name: limits.task-scheduler.thread-pool-size
properties.description: The quantity of threads allotted to the TaskScheduler

properties.name: limits.topic.csv.column-separator
properties.description: The character used to separate columns in a file

properties.name: limits.topic.csv.incomplete-lines
properties.description: If true, parser will attempt to parse lines with missing columns

properties.name: limits.topic.csv.overflow-lines
properties.description: If true, parser will attempt to parse lines with too many columns

properties.name: limits.topic.csv.process-quotes
properties.description: If true, the parser will parse values in double quotes

properties.name: limits.topic.csv.skipped-lines
properties.description: The number of lines to skip when parsing a file

properties.name: limits.workflow.allowed-file-upload-extensions
properties.description: The file types allowed to be uploaded as attachments in the workflow.

properties.name: limits.workflow.enable-bulk-activiti-transactions
properties.description: True when users want to execute activiti transactions in bulk, false when they should be executed sequentially

properties.name: limits.workflow.exception-workflows
properties.description: A Map of the exception workflow name to the workflow configuration properties.

properties.name: limits.workflow.file-attachments-are-read-only
properties.description: When set to true, the file attachments in the workflow are set to read-only on the file system.

properties.name: limits.workflow.file-storage-path
properties.description: The path where the workflow attachment files are stored. Please ensure users have access to this folder.

properties.name: limits.workflow.limit-workflows
properties.description: A Map of the limit workflow name to the workflow configuration properties.

properties.name: limits.workflow.roles
properties.description: List of roles for a given workflow.

properties.name: limits.workflow.workflow-rules.can-approver-be-same-as-creator
properties.description: If true, the creator of a limit may also approve it.

properties.name: limits.workflow.workflow-status-fetched-with-limit
properties.description: When set to true, retrieving limit structures also updates the limit status with the current workflow status.
